title: Väitös: Merkit lukihäiriöstä voidaan tunnistaa vastasyntyneiden aivoissa
content: Väitös: Merkit lukihäiriöstä voidaan tunnistaa vastasyntyneiden aivoissa txrissan@helsinki.fi Thu, 05/02/2026 - 11:28 Väitöskirjatutkijamme Sergio Navarrete Arroyo väitteli lukivaikeuden varhaisesta tunnistamisesta ja vauvan aivotoiminnan yhteyksistä myöhemmän lukutaidon kehitykseen perjantaina 24.10. title: Peixin Nie defended her PhD thesis
content: Peixin Nie defended her PhD thesis txrissan@helsinki.fi Thu, 05/02/2026 - 11:22 Peixin Nie defended her PhD thesis on Sept. 5th, titled "The Potential Transfer Effect of Music Learning on Verbal Working Memory: Modulations by Native Language Background?" The studies investigated the transfer effects of music learning in Finnish speakers and Mandarin Chinese speakers  and the potential interactions between music and language. content: Love Data Week 9.-13.2.2026 uvirolai@helsinki.fi Wed, 04/02/2026 - 15:47 The Nordic Love Data Week 2026 offers a wide range of online events organized by research data management experts from Nordic universities. title: Luonnontieteellinen museo suljetaan huoltoviikon ajaksi
content: The Natural History Museum will be closed during the maintenance week johanemi@helsinki.fi Fri, 09/01/2026 - 14:10 The museum will be closed during the maintenance week, Mon–Fri, 12–16 January 2026. The doors will reopen on Saturday, 17 January. The Natural History Museum will be closed during the maintenance week, Mon–Fri, 12–16 January. The week's tasks include small repair works and thorough cleaning of the exhibitions, such as vacuuming dioramas and washing the dinosaur. The museum will be o...

content: Renewal of Arkadiankatu Bridge will cause changes to traffic arrangements near the Natural History Museum johanemi@helsinki.fi Wed, 07/01/2026 - 08:40 The renovation is expected to be completed in late 2026. title: Kotina metsä -näyttely tuo luonnonmetsän keskelle Helsinkiä
content: Forest Home – Exhibition brings a natural forest to the heart of Helsinki johanemi@helsinki.fi Fri, 30/05/2025 - 14:09 In Finland, natural forests have become a rarity – and for many, they remain unfamiliar. The Forest Home exhibition invites visitors to discover them through photography, video installations and scientific specimens. Forest Home is on display at the Natural History Museum until 5 April 2026. Photographic artists Ritva Kovalainen and Sanni Seppo explore the rich life of natural f...
